name: Smoky Duck Bread (sheet pan)
description: Smoky duck with bread in a sheet pan style.
keywords: smoky, duck, bread, sheet pan, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Toss duck and vegetables with oil, salt, and spices; spread in an even layer.
Roast until the duck is cooked through and vegetables are caramelized, 24 minutes, stirring once.
Finish with fresh herbs; season to taste.

name: Herbed Lamb Couscous (bowls)
description: Herbed lamb with couscous in a bowls style.
keywords: herbed, lamb, couscous, bowls, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Sear the lamb in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 3 minutes.
Whisk together dressing with oil, acid, and a pinch of sweetener, if desired.
Toss greens/grains, vegetables, and warm protein with the dressing.
Top with herbs, a squeeze of citrus, and any crunchy garnish.
Serve immediately.

name: Smoky Tofu Polenta (curry)
description: Smoky tofu with polenta in a curry style.
keywords: smoky, tofu, polenta, curry, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.
Add spices and tomato paste; cook 1 minute to bloom.
Sear the tofu in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 5 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth; simmer gently until flavors meld, 10 minutes.
Finish with a knob of butter; season to taste.

name: Chili-Lime Turkey Potatoes (pasta)
description: Chili-lime turkey with potatoes in a pasta style.
keywords: chili-lime, turkey, potatoes, pasta, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Sear the turkey in 1 tbsp oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 4 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, 2–4 minutes.
Stir in aromatics and spices; cook until fragrant, 43 seconds.
Deglaze with a splash of water, scraping up browned bits.
Toss with the pasta until coated and heated through, 3 minutes.

name: Creamy Pork Noodles (stew)
description: Creamy pork with noodles in a stew style.
keywords: creamy, pork, noodles, stew, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.
Add spices and tomato paste; cook 1 minute to bloom.
Sear the pork in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 6 minutes.
Pour in beef stock; simmer gently until flavors meld, 9 minutes.
Finish with a squeeze of citrus; season to taste.

name: Teriyaki Tempeh Potatoes (grill)
description: Teriyaki tempeh with potatoes in a grill style.
keywords: teriyaki, tempeh, potatoes, grill, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated gruyère or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine oil, lime juice, coriander, and a pinch of salt. Toss tempeh to coat; marinate 19 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium-high. Clean and oil grates.
Grill tempeh until lightly charred and cooked through, turning once, 10 minutes total.
Grill vegetables until tender with some color, 3–6 minutes.
Rest protein 5 minutes; slice.
Finish with fresh herbs; season to taste.

keywords: peppercorn, tofu, potatoes, stir-fry, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Sear the tofu in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 6 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, 2–4 minutes.
Stir in aromatics and spices; cook until fragrant, 48 seconds.
Deglaze with a splash of water, scraping up browned bits.
Stir in liquids and reduce slightly, 2–3 minutes.
Finish with a squeeze of citrus; season to taste.

name: Miso Beef Polenta (tacos)
description: Miso beef with polenta in a tacos style.
keywords: miso, beef, polenta, tacos, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated feta or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Sear the beef in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 6 minutes.
Whisk together dressing with oil, acid, and a pinch of sweetener, if desired.
Warm or toast the tortillas.
Layer with vegetables, sauce, and sliced beef.
Top with herbs, a squeeze of citrus, and any crunchy garnish.
Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Mushroom Farro (stew)
description: Garlic mushroom with farro in a stew style.
keywords: garlic, mushroom, farro, stew, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated mozzarella or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.

keywords: chili-lime, beef, couscous, salad, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated cotija or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Sear the beef in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 4 minutes.
Whisk together dressing with oil, acid, and a pinch of sweetener, if desired.
Toss greens/grains, vegetables, and warm protein with the dressing.
Top with herbs, a squeeze of citrus, and any crunchy garnish.
Serve immediately.

name: Chili-Lime Turkey Soba (skillet)
description: Chili-lime turkey with soba in a skillet style.
keywords: chili-lime, turkey, soba, skillet, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Sear the turkey in 1 tbsp oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 4 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, 2–4 minutes.
Stir in aromatics and spices; cook until fragrant, 59 seconds.
Deglaze with lime juice, scraping up browned bits.
Toss with the soba until coated and heated through, 3 minutes.
Finish with fresh herbs; season to taste.

recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Set pressure cooker to Sauté; add oil.
Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.

keywords: chili-lime, cauliflower, udon, bake, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated cheddar or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Toss cauliflower and vegetables with oil, salt, and spices; spread in an even layer.
Roast until the cauliflower is cooked through and vegetables are caramelized, 18 minutes, stirring once.
Finish with a squeeze of citrus; season to taste.

name: Garlic Turkey Barley (grill)
description: Garlic turkey with barley in a grill style.
keywords: garlic, turkey, barley, grill, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated cheddar or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine oil, rice vinegar, cayenne, and a pinch of salt. Toss turkey to coat; marinate 23 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium-high. Clean and oil grates.
Grill turkey until lightly charred and cooked through, turning once, 9 minutes total.
Grill vegetables until tender with some color, 3–6 minutes.
Rest protein 5 minutes; slice.
Finish with fresh herbs; season to taste.

name: Honey-Lime Lentil Polenta (soup)
description: Honey-lime lentil with polenta in a soup style.
keywords: honey-lime, lentil, polenta, soup, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.
Add spices and tomato paste; cook 1 minute to bloom.
Sear the lentil in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 5 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth; simmer gently until flavors meld, 12 minutes.
Finish with fresh herbs; season to taste.

name: Chili-Lime Chicken Barley (skillet)
description: Chili-lime chicken with barley in a skillet style.
keywords: chili-lime, chicken, barley, skillet, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Sear the chicken in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 6 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, 2–4 minutes.
Stir in aromatics and spices; cook until fragrant, 31 seconds.
Deglaze with red wine vinegar, scraping up browned bits.
Stir in liquids and reduce slightly, 2–3 minutes.
Finish with a knob of butter; season to taste.

name: Tomato-Basil Lentil Bread (bake)
description: Tomato-basil lentil with bread in a bake style.
keywords: tomato-basil, lentil, bread, bake, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Toss lentil and vegetables with oil, salt, and spices; spread in an even layer.
Roast until the lentil is cooked through and vegetables are caramelized, 28 minutes, stirring once.
Finish with a squeeze of citrus; season to taste.

name: Smoky Beef Barley (skillet)
description: Smoky beef with barley in a skillet style.
keywords: smoky, beef, barley, skillet, easy, weeknight
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt & black pepper, to taste
0.25 cups grated feta or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pan to medium-high heat. Add oil and swirl to coat.
Sear the beef in 1 tbsp oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 3 minutes.
Add vegetables and cook, stirring, until crisp-tender, 2–4 minutes.
Stir in aromatics and spices; cook until fragrant, 35 seconds.
Deglaze with sherry vinegar, scraping up browned bits.
Stir in liquids and reduce slightly, 2–3 minutes.
Finish with a squeeze of citrus; season to taste.

name: Spicy Beef Pasta (slow cooker)
description: Spicy beef with pasta in a slow cooker style.
keywords: spicy, beef, pasta, slow cooker, easy, weeknight

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté aromatics with a pinch of salt until softened, 3–4 minutes.
Add spices and tomato paste; cook 1 minute to bloom.
Sear the beef in a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, 5 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth; simmer gently until flavors meld, 9 minutes.
Transfer to slow cooker and cook on LOW 4–6 hours or HIGH 2–3 hours.
Finish with a knob of butter; season to taste.
